name: Ilam Park to Wetton Circular Walk, Ilam Park

ai.summary: A demanding 49-kilometre circular hike starting at Ilam Park and returning via Wetton, featuring mixed countryside, fields, woodlands, and limestone dales. Suited to experienced hikers comfortable with long distances and variable weather; expect rolling climbs, stony paths, and muddy sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including farm tracks, grassy paths, muddy woodland trails, and occasional steep ascents and descents. Expect stiles, gates, and some exposed sections; footing can be uneven and damp after rain; long sections involve miles of countryside walking with limited cover.
ai.safety_notes: Plan as a long day out and inform someone of your route and timings; check the forecast and be prepared for sudden weather changes; bring a detailed map and navigation tools, plus a charged phone as a backup; carry enough water and high-energy food; stay aware of livestock, farm traffic, and gate etiquette; stay on marked paths and respect private land; in remote stretches cell coverage may be limited; allow extra time for difficult sections and contingencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Layered clothing plus waterproof outer shell
Water and high-energy snacks (2–3 litres recommended)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and a power bank
First aid kit and blister care
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Extra warm layers and windproof layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October), though weather can change quickly in the UK.

seo.title: Ilam Park to Wetton Circular Walk – 49 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Ilam Park to Wetton Circular Walk, a challenging 49 km route through countryside with varied terrain. Practical safety tips and gear recommendations for a long-distance hike.
seo.h1: Ilam Park to Wetton Circular Walk – 49 km Hard Hike
